member.summary: Makes sure that the animated object has the needed opacity mask.

Adds a vertical or horizontal opacity mask of the kind:
<LinearGradientBrush EndPoint="0 1"> <LinearGradientBrush.RelativeTransform> <TranslateTransform Y="0" /> </LinearGradientBrush.RelativeTransform> <GradientStop Offset="0" Color="Transparent" /> <GradientStop Offset="0" Color="Black" /> <GradientStop Offset="1" Color="Black" /> <GradientStop Offset="1" Color="Transparent" /> </LinearGradientBrush>
member.param: The object to set the mask for.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.KeyboardModifiers
member.summary: This class presents a way to query the state of the various keyboard modifier keys. It also allows you to check the state of the shortcut key for the current platform.
member.remarks: The different platforms Silverlight runs on employ differing input conventions. Thus shortcuts for common actions such as Copy, Paste and Select All are activated using one key on Windows (Control), but using another on Mac OS X (Apple). Using this class should save you tedious platform checks. It is inadvisable, however, to use the IsShortcutKeyDown property before you've researched what the accepted shortcut for the relevant platform is. Even though this class addresses a Silverlight scenario, it will also work on WPF.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.KeyboardModifiers.PlatformID
member.summary: Gets or sets the PlatformID.
member.remarks: You only need to use this if you wish to mock this class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Function that provides a ModifierKeys value.
member.remarks: You only need to use this if you wish to mock this class.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.KeyboardModifiers.Modifiers
member.summary: Gets the keyboard modifier keys.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.KeyboardModifiers.IsShortcutKeyDown
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the platform-specific shortcut meta key is pressed.
member.remarks: For most systems (Windows + Linux) the shortcut key is Control. However, under Mac OS X the shortcut key is Apple (Command). Note that you still have to know if the relevant shortcut on Mac uses Command, because it can be entirely different.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.KeyboardModifiers.IsControlDown
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the Control key is pressed.
member.value: true if the Control key is pressed; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the Alt key is pressed.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.KeyboardModifiers.IsShiftDown
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the Shift key is pressed.
member.value: true if the Shift key is pressed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.KeyboardModifiers.IsCommandDown
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the Apple (Command) key is pressed.
member.value: true if the Apple (Command) key is pressed; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This is only applicable on Silverlight under Mac OS X.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.InheritanceContextPropagator
member.summary: This class is used to propagate inheritance context to non-visual class instances that might be part of the WPF control element tree. Note that while it relies on the special notion that Freezable classes have for "inheritance context", you should not rely on any other characteristics that Freezable objects usually have (cloning, freezing, etc.). Actually this object will explicitly prevent the framework from freezing its instances and it will generally behave as any other non-Freezable object.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.InheritanceContextPropagator.CreateInstanceCore
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, creates a new instance of the derived class.
member.returns: The new instance.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.InheritanceContextPropagator.FreezeCore(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes the object unmodifiable or tests whether it can be made unmodifiable.
member.param: True to return an indication of whether the object can be frozen (without actually freezing it); false to actually freeze the object.
member.returns: If is true, this method returns true if the can be made unmodifiable, or false if it cannot be made unmodifiable. If is false, this method returns true if the if the specified is now unmodifiable, or false if it cannot be made unmodifiable.

member.summary: The base class for drag-drop operation behaviors.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.DragDrop.Behaviors.IDragDropBehavior`1.CanStartDrag(`0)
member.summary: Gets the value specifying whether the drag operation can be started, or not.
member.param: DragDropState that provides context for the current operation.
member.returns: True when the drag operation can be started, otherwise false.
member.remarks: This method is called only when the drag operation initiated.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.DragDrop.Behaviors.IDragDropBehavior`1.CanDrop(`0)
member.summary: Gets the value specifying whether the drag operation can be completed, or not.
member.param: DragDropState identifying the current drag operation.
member.returns: True when the drag operation can be finished, otherwise false.
member.remarks: This method is called on every mouse move. All properties in the DragDropState are valid.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.DragDrop.Behaviors.IDragDropBehavior`1.Drop(`0)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class completes the drop operation. This method is called only in the context of the drop target control.
member.param: DragDropState that provides context for the current operation.
member.remarks: When the drag source and the drop target are the same control, this method is called before DragCompleted.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.DragDrop.Behaviors.IDragDropBehavior`1.DragDropCanceled(`0)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class cleans up a cancelled drag operation. This method is called only in the context of the drag source control.
member.param: DragDropState that provides context for the current operation.
member.remarks: This method is called only when the drag operation is cancelled by the user. If this method is called, the source's DragDropCompleted and target's Drop methods are not called.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.DragDrop.Behaviors.IDragDropBehavior`1.DragDropCompleted(`0)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class completes the drag operation. This method is called only in the context of the drag source control.
member.param: DragDropState that provides context for the current operation.
member.remarks: When the drag source and the drop target are the same control, this method is called after Drop. This method is called only when the drag operation completed successfully. If this method is called, DragDropCanceled is not called.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.DragDrop.Behaviors.IDragDropBehavior`1.CoerceDraggedItems(`0)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, filters the dragged items collection if necessary.
member.param: DragDropState that provides context for the current operation.
member.returns: The filtered dragged items.
member.remarks: This method is called immediately before the drag operation starts. Only the Items property of the DragDropState is valid.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.DragDrop.Behaviors.DragDropBehavior`1.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.remarks: This method is called only when the drag operation is cancelled by the user. If this method is called, the source's DragDropCompleted and target's Drop methods are not called.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.DragDrop.Behaviors.IDragPayload
member.summary: Provides a format independent mechanism for transferring data.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.DragDrop.Behaviors.IDragPayload.GetData(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a data object in a specified format, and optionally, converts the data to the specified format.
member.param: A string that specifies the format in which to retrieve the data. See the class for a set of predefined data formats.

True to attempt to automatically convert the data to the specified format; false to perform no data format conversion.If this parameter is false, the method returns data in the specified format if it is available; or returns null if the data is not available in the specified format.
member.returns: A data object that has the data in the specified format; or null, if the data is not available in the specified format.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.DragDrop.Behaviors.IDragPayload.GetData(System.Type)
member.summary: Retrieves a data object in a specified format; the data format is specified by a object.
member.param: A object that specifies the format in which to retrieve the data. See the class for a set of predefined data formats.
member.returns: A data object that has the data in the specified format; or null, if the data is not available in the specified format.

member.summary: Retrieves a data object in a specified format; the data format is specified by a string.
member.param: A string that specifies the format in which to retrieve the data. See the class for a set of predefined data formats.
member.returns: A data object that has the data in the specified format; or null, if the data is not available in the specified format.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.DragDrop.Behaviors.IDragPayload.GetDataPresent(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks whether the data is available in, or can be converted to, a specified format. If the data is not already available in the specified format, a Boolean flag indicates whether to check if the data can be converted to the specified format.
member.param: A string that specifies the format to check for. See the class for a set of predefined data formats.
False to only check for the specified format; true to also check whether the data that is stored in this data object can be converted to the specified format.
member.returns: True if the data is in, or can be converted to, the specified format; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.DragDrop.Behaviors.IDragPayload.GetDataPresent(System.Type)
member.summary: Checks to see whether the data is available in, or can be converted to, a specified format. The data format is specified by a object.
member.param: A that specifies the format to check for.
member.returns: True if the data is in, or can be converted to, the specified format; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.DragDrop.Behaviors.IDragPayload.GetDataPresent(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether the data is available in, or can be converted to, a specified format; the data format is specified by a string.
member.param: A string that specifies the format to check for. See the class for a set of predefined data formats.
member.returns: True if the data is in, or can be converted to, the specified format; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.DragDrop.Behaviors.IDragPayload.GetFormats(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a list of all formats that the data in this data object is stored in. A Boolean flag indicates whether to also include formats that the data can be automatically converted to.
member.param: True to retrieve all formats that the data in this data object is stored in, or can be converted to; false to retrieve only the formats in which the data in this data object is stored (excludes formats that the data is not stored in, but can be automatically converted to).
member.returns: An array of strings, with each string specifying the name of a format that is supported by this data object.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.DragDrop.Behaviors.IDragPayload.GetFormats
member.summary: Returns a list of all formats that the data in this data object is stored in, or can be converted to.
member.returns: An array of strings, with each string specifying the name of a format that is supported by this data object.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.DragDrop.Behaviors.IDragPayload.SetData(System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stores the specified data in this data object, using one or more specified data formats. This overload includes a Boolean flag to indicate whether the data may be converted to another format on retrieval.
member.param: A string that specifies the format in which to store the data. See the class for a set of predefined data formats.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.DragDrop.DragDropManager.AddDragInitializeHandler(System.Windows.DependencyObject,Telerik.Windows.DragDrop.DragInitializeEventHandler)
member.summary: Adds a DragInitialize event handler to a specified dependency object.
member.param: The dependency object (a UIElement or ContentElement) to which to add the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to be added.
member.remarks: The DragInitialize event occurs when an object is about to be dragged. All needed information about the drag should be passed to the event arguments. Drag start can be stopped by setting Cancel=true.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.DragDrop.DragDropManager.AddDragInitializeHandler(System.Windows.DependencyObject,Telerik.Windows.DragDrop.DragInitializeEventHandler,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a DragInitialize event handler to a specified dependency object.
member.param: The dependency object (a UIElement or ContentElement) to which to add the event handler.
A delegate that references the handler method to be added.

True to register the handler such that it is invoked even when the routed event is marked handled in its event data; false to register the handler with the default condition that it will not be invoked if the routed event is already marked handled. The default is false.
member.remarks: The DragInitialize event occurs when an object is about to be dragged. All needed information about the drag should be passed to the event arguments. Drag start can be stopped by setting Cancel=true.

member.summary: The element does not have additional logic for swiping.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Input.Touch.ScrollViewerSwipeMode.Self
member.summary: The element is expected to be a ScrollViewer and if an unhandled swipe gesture occurs, the ScrollViewer will get panned.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Input.Touch.ScrollViewerSwipeMode.Parent
member.summary: If an unhandled swipe gesture occurs for this element, the first ScrollViewer parent will get panned.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Input.Touch.TouchMode
member.summary: Represents the touch mode of a control.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Input.Touch.TouchMode.HitTestVisible
member.summary: The element is visible for touch input and events will route normally.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Input.Touch.TouchMode.HitTestHidden
member.summary: The element is not visible for touch input. Touch events will be raised for the element's parents as if this element is not in the visual tree.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Input.Touch.TouchMode.Locked
member.summary: The element is visible for touch input and it will capture the touch device on touch down and will mark all touch events as handled, thus preventing event routing.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Input.Touch.TouchMode.None
member.summary: The element will suppress all touch events. No touch events will be raised for touch input within the boundaries of the element.

member.summary: Represents the touch action which triggers a drag operation.

member.summary: A drag operation will be triggered during a TouchMove event after a TapAndHold event.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Input.Touch.TouchDragStartTrigger.TouchMove
member.summary: A drag operation will be triggered during a TouchMove, regardless of whether or not a TapAndHold event has occurred.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Input.Touch.TouchDragStartTrigger.TapAndHold
member.summary: A drag operation will be triggered during a TapAndHold event.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Input.Touch.GestureRecognizerBase
member.summary: A specific gesture recognizer. The inheritors of this class should handle the basic touch events and translate them to specific gesture related events. A recognizer can be responsible for a family of gestures (for example Tap, TapAndHold, TapHoldAndRelease). A recognizer can be responsible for a family of events (for example SwipeStarted, Swipe, SwipeFinished).

Shadow for the .

Avoid setting child element as any text in it would receive the DropShadowEffect resulting in blurred appearance of the text.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ListBoxPanel.ExtendDesiredSize(System.Windows.Size,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: DesiredSize is normally computed by summing up the size of all items we've generated. Pixel-based virtualization uses a 'full' desired size. This extends the given desired size beyond the visible items. It will extend it by the items before or after the set of generated items. The given pivotIndex is the index of either the first or last item generated.
member.param: Size of the stack desired.
Index of the pivot.

member.summary: Immediately cleans up any containers that have gone off-screen. Called by MeasureOverride. When recycling this runs before generating and measuring children; otherwise it runs after.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ListBoxPanel.ChildIndexFromRealizedIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Takes an index from the realized list and returns the corresponding index in the Children collection.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ListBoxPanel.AdjustFirstVisibleChildIndex(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Called after 'count' items were removed or recycled from the Generator. _firstVisibleChildIndex is the index of the first visible container. This index isn't exactly the child position in the UIElement collection; it's actually the index of the realized container inside the generator. Since we've just removed some realized containers from the generator (by calling Remove or Recycle), we have to adjust the first visible child index.
member.param: Index of the first removed item.
Number of items removed.

member.summary: Returns the index of the generated item. Not used in hierarchical virtualization.
member.param: The index of the child for which a generated index will be returned.
member.returns: A generated index for the item container generator.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ListBoxPanel.ScrollData
member.summary: Helper class to hold scrolling data.
member.remarks: This class exists to reduce working set when FeedsPanel is used outside a scrolling situation. Standard "extra pointer always for less data sometimes" cache savings model: !Scroll [1xReference] Scroll [1xReference] + [6xDouble + 1xReference].

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ScrollData class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Scroll offset of content. Positive corresponds to a visually upward offset. Set by methods like LineUp, PageDown, etc.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.ListBoxPanel.ScrollData.ComputedOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the computed offset based on _offset set by the IScrollInfo methods. Set at the end of a successful Measure pass. This is the offset used by Arrange and exposed externally. Thus an offset set by PageDown via IScrollInfo isn't reflected publicly (e.g. via the VerticalOffset property) until a Measure pass.

The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PlacementMode
member.summary: Describes the placement of where a Popup control appears on the screen.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PlacementMode.Absolute
member.summary: A position of the Popup control relative to the upper-left corner of the screen and at an offset that is defined by the HorizontalOffset and VerticalOffset property values. If the screen edge obscures the Popup, the control then repositions itself to align with the edge.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PlacementMode.Relative
member.summary: A position of the Popup control relative to the upper-left corner of the PlacementTarget and at an offset that is defined by the HorizontalOffset and VerticalOffset property values. If the screen edge obscures the Popup, the control repositions itself to align with the screen edge.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PlacementMode.Bottom
member.summary: A position of the Popup control where the control aligns its upper edge with the lower edge of the PlacementTarget and aligns its left edge with the left edge of the PlacementTarget. If the lower screen-edge obscures the Popup, the control repositions itself so that its lower edge aligns with the upper edge of the PlacementTarget. If the upper screen-edge obscures the Popup, the control then repositions itself so that its upper edge aligns with the upper screen-edge.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PlacementMode.Center
member.summary: A position of the Popup control where it is centered over the PlacementTarget. If a screen edge obscures the Popup, the control repositions itself to align with the screen edge.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PlacementMode.Right
member.summary: A position of the Popup control that aligns its left edge with the right edge of the PlacementTarget and aligns its upper edge with the upper edge of the PlacementTarget. If the right screen-edge obscures the Popup, the control repositions itself so that its left edge aligns with the left edge of the PlacementTarget. If the left screen-edge obscures the Popup, the control repositions itself so that its left edge aligns with the left screen-edge. If the upper or lower screen-edge obscures the Popup, the control then repositions itself to align with the obscuring screen edge.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PlacementMode.AbsolutePoint
member.summary: A position of the Popup control relative to the upper-left corner of the screen and at an offset that is defined by the HorizontalOffset and VerticalOffset property values. If the screen edge obscures the Popup, the control extends in the opposite direction from the axis defined by the HorizontalOffset or VerticalOffset.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PlacementMode.RelativePoint
member.summary: A position of the Popup control relative to the upper-left corner of the PlacementTarget and at an offset that is defined by the HorizontalOffset and VerticalOffset property values. If a screen edge obscures the Popup, the Popup extends in the opposite direction from the direction from the axis defined by the HorizontalOffset or VerticalOffset. If the opposite screen edge also obscures the Popup, the control then aligns with this screen edge.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PlacementMode.Mouse
member.summary: A position of the Popup control that aligns its upper edge with the lower edge of the bounding box of the mouse and aligns its left edge with the left edge of the bounding box of the mouse. If the lower screen-edge obscures the Popup, it repositions itself to align with the upper edge of the bounding box of the mouse. If the upper screen-edge obscures the Popup, the control repositions itself to align with the upper screen-edge.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PlacementMode.MousePoint
member.summary: A position of the Popup control relative to the tip of the mouse cursor and at an offset that is defined by the HorizontalOffset and VerticalOffset property values. If a horizontal or vertical screen edge obscures the Popup, it opens in the opposite direction from the obscuring edge. If the opposite screen edge also obscures the Popup, it then aligns with the obscuring screen edge.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PlacementMode.Left
member.summary: A Popup control that aligns its right edge with the left edge of the PlacementTarget and aligns its upper edge with the upper edge of the PlacementTarget. If the left screen-edge obscures the Popup, the Popup repositions itself so that its left edge aligns with the right edge of the PlacementTarget. If the right screen-edge obscures the Popup, the right edge of the control aligns with the right screen-edge. If the upper or lower screen-edge obscures the Popup, the control repositions itself to align with the obscuring screen edge.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Controls.PlacementMode.Top
member.summary: A position of the Popup control that aligns its lower edge with the upper edge of the PlacementTarget and aligns its left edge with the left edge of the PlacementTarget. If the upper screen-edge obscures the Popup, the control repositions itself so that its upper edge aligns with the lower edge of the PlacementTarget. If the lower screen-edge obscures the Popup, the lower edge of the control aligns with the lower screen-edge. If the left or right screen-edge obscures the Popup, it then repositions itself to align with the obscuring screen.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadProgressBar
member.summary: The RadProgressBar control can be used to to indicate the progress of an operation. It gives to an end-user visual feedback about an operation he is waiting for to complete.
member.remarks: The RadProgressBar control should be used as a visual indication of the progress of an operation. The developer is responsible for programmatically updating the value of the RadProgressBar, while the control takes care of the visual representation of its value.

list.item: Single (default) - Only one item can be expanded at a time. Expanding another item collapses the previously expanded one.
Multiple - More than one item can be expanded at a time.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Arc class.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Shapes.Arc.Diameter
member.summary: Gets or sets the diameter of the generated arc graphic. It is recommended to use the same value for Width, Height and Diameter.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Shapes.Arc.StartAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle of the start point of the arc in degrees. The default is 10 which is near the right center. ~90 will be bottom ~180 left and ~270 top.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Shapes.Arc.EndAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle of the end point of the arc in degrees. The default is 350 which is near the right center. ~90 will be bottom ~180 left and ~270 top.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Shapes.Arc.ArcThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the thickness of the arc geometry. The value is the thickness in pixels in StretchMode="None" stretch mode. When the value increases the arc geometry expands toward the center of the arc. Do not set it to more than half the Diameter.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Shapes.Arc.MaximumProgress
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum possible value of the Arc's Progress. It is designed to ease the Arc use in progress bars. Check the Progress property for more information.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Shapes.Arc.MinimumProgress
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum possible value of the Arc's Progress. It is designed to ease the Arc use in progress bars. Check the Progress property for more information.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Shapes.Arc.Progress
member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage of the arc to be drawn. Should be in range [MaximumProgress MinimumProgress]. The arc is drawn in clockwise direction from the StartAngle towards the EndAngle. Setting this property to MaximumProgress will draw all the arc. MaximumProgress * 0.5 + MinimumProgress * 0.5 - half of it. MinimumProgress - none of it. It is designed to ease the Arc use in progress bars.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Shapes.Arc.CapRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets the caps of the arc. 0 will use straight cut of a donut. Setting it to half the ArcThickness will draw geometry with circle ends of the arc. It is recommended to be in range from 0 to half the ArcThickness.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Shapes.Arc.DefiningGeometry
member.summary: Gets the geometry rendered by the shape. For the Arc class it is a partial donut.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DoubleRangeBase.IsSelectionRangeEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the RadSlider can displays a selection range. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks: The SelectionStart and SelectionEnd properties define a selection range and must be set for the selection range to appear when IsSelectionRangeEnabled is set to true.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DoubleRangeBase.IsCoercionSuppressed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the slider should coerce the setting of related properties like Value, SelectionStart, SelectionEnd, Minimum, Maximum, MinimumRangeSpan and MaximumRangeSpan.
member.remarks: If set to True, the coercion is done only when the user manipulates the slider and not if the related properties are set by code or through binding.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DoubleRangeBase.SelectionRange
member.summary: Gets the difference between SelectionStart and SelectionEnd.
member.value: The difference between SelectionStart and SelectionEnd.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DoubleRangeBase.Selection
member.summary: Gets or sets the selection - SelectionStart and SelectionEnd.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DoubleRangeBase.SelectionEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets the largest value of a specified selection.
member.remarks: The value of the SelectionEnd property cannot be greater than the value of the Maximum property and cannot be less than the value of the Minimum property. The value of the SelectionEnd property must also be greater than or equal to the value of the SelectionStart property. If the value of the SelectionEnd property is greater than the value of the Maximum property or less than the value of the Minimum property, the value is set to the value of the Maximum or Minimum property respectively.

example.code: <telerik:RadSlider x:Name="radSlider1" Width="100" Orientation="Horizontal" Minimum="0" Maximum="10" TickPlacement="TopLeft" TickFrequency="1" IsSelectionRangeEnabled="True" SelectionEnd="8" SelectionStart="6"/>

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DoubleRangeBase.SelectionStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the smallest value of a specified selection.
member.remarks: IsSelectionRangeEnabled must be True in order to use SelectionStart and SelectionEnd The value of the SelectionStart property cannot be less than the value of the Minimum property and cannot be greater than the value of the Maximum property. The value of the SelectionEnd property must also be greater than or equal to the value of the SelectionStart property. If SelectionStart is less than Minimum or greater than Maximum, SelectionStart is set to the value of Minimum or Maximum respectively.

example.code: <telerik:RadSlider x:Name="radSlider1" Width="100" Orientation="Horizontal" Minimum="0" Maximum="10" TickPlacement="TopLeft" TickFrequency="1" IsSelectionRangeEnabled="True" SelectionEnd="8" SelectionStart="6"/>

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DoubleRangeBase.MinimumRangeSpan
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value distance between SelectionStart and SelectionEnd.
member.remarks: The IsSelectionRangeEnabled property of RadSlider has to be set to True.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.DoubleRangeBase.MaximumRangeSpan
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value distance between SelectionStart and SelectionEnd.
member.remarks: The IsSelectionRangeEnabled property of RadSlider has to be set to True.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the control is arranged.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is user manipulation in progress.
member.value: True if this instance is user manipulation in progress; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.EnableSideTicks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether side ticks are enabled.
member.value: True if side ticks are enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.StepAction
member.summary: This property determines how the slider will behave when in range mode. Setting this property to ChangeRange will move only the corresponding thumb when Large or Small step is performed. Setting the property to MoveRange will move the whole range when Large or Small change has been performed.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.Delay
member.summary: Gets or sets the Delay property of the Increase and Decrease handles.
member.remarks: Each click on any of the handles increases/decreases the value by the amount that is set to the SmallChange property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.HandlesVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets the Visibility property of the Increase and Decrease handles.
member.remarks: Each click on any of the handles increases/decreases the value by the amount that is set to the SmallChange property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.RepeatInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the RepeatInterval property of the Increase and Decrease handles.
member.remarks: Each click on any of the handles increases/decreases the value by the amount that is set to the SmallChange property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.IsDirectionReversed
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of increasing value. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks:
The value of this property determines the direction of increasing value of a RadRadSlider.
For example, when you move the thumb control up on a vertical RadSlider when the IsDirectionReversed property is set to false, the Value of the RadSlider increases. If the value of the IsDirectionReversed property is changed to true, the Value of the RadSlider decreases as the thumb moves up.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.IsMoveToPointEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the thumb of a RadSlider moves immediately to the location of the mouse click that occurs while the mouse pointer pauses on the RadSlider track. This is a dependency property.
member.remarks: When this property is set to false and a mouse click occurs along the RadSlider away from the thumb, the thumb moves in the direction of the mouse click. Instead of moving immediately to the mouse click location, the thumb moves a distance that is defined by the RepeatInterval property for each mouse click. The effect of multiple mouse clicks can be emulated by pressing and holding the left mouse button until the thumb is repositioned to the desired location.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.IsSnapToTickEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the RadSlider automatically moves the thumb to the closest tick mark. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of a RadSlider. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.IsMouseWheelEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the wheel of the mouse can be used for sliding the thumb. This is dependency property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.TickFrequency
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval between tick marks. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.TickPlacement
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of tick marks with respect to the track of the RadSlider. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.Ticks
member.summary: Gets or sets the positions of the tick marks to display for a RadSlider. This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.TickTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the TickTemplate that will be used to represent a single tick on the TickBar.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.TickTemplateSelector
member.summary: Gets or sets the TickTemplateSelector that will be used to pick a template for the tick marks.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.ThumbVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of the thumb(s) in RadSlider.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.IsDeferredDraggingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the content is stationary when the user drags the Thumb of RadSlider. This is dependency property.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.MiddleThumbClickMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines the click action of the Middle Thumb of RadSlider. This is dependency property.
member.remarks: The MiddleThumbClickMode actions will take effect only in there is no drag action of the middle thumb. If the middle thumb is dragged, then no click mode action will be performed.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.AutoToolTipPlacement
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a tooltip that contains the current value of the RadSlider displays when the Thumb is pressed. If a tooltip is displayed, this property also specifies the placement of the tooltip.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.RadSlider.AutoToolTipContentTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the template used to display the content of the RadSlider's tooltip.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionControl.LayoutAnimationPanel.WidthScale
member.summary: Gets or Sets the WidthScale property that is used to scale horizontally the layout box desired by the panel but without scaling the rendering image.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionControl.LayoutAnimationPanel.HeightScale
member.summary: Gets or Sets the HeightScale property that is used to scale vertically the layout box desired by the panel but without scaling the rendering image.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionControl.LayoutAnimationPanel.MaxHeightWeight
member.summary: Gets or Sets the MaxHeightWeight. After a desired height is determined by all children's weighted height, they will be multiplied by (1 - MaxHeightWeight) and the largest child's height will be added multiplied by MaxHeightWeight to determine the final panel desired height. Setting this property to 1 will set the desired height of the panel to the desired height of the largest child.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionControl.LayoutAnimationPanel.MaxWidthWeight
member.summary: Gets or Sets the MaxWidthWeight. After a desired width is determined by all children's weighted widths, they will be multiplied by (1 - MaxWidthWeight) and the largest child's width will be added multiplied by MaxWidthWeight to determine the final panel desired width. Setting this property to 1 will set the desired width of the panel to the desired width of the largest child.

member.summary: Creates a new TransitionEffect with the current settings.

member.summary: Sets the Color of the burning effect.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.MappedLightTransition.OverBurn
member.summary: Sets the "overburn" value. Default value is 1. 0 sets no "overburn" and the transition looks like fade effect. Greater than 4 goes white on most images.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.MappedLightTransition.ProgressMap
member.summary: A map that indicates the order of the progress of the pixels. White areas of the map transition before.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.MappedLightTransition.WaveLength
member.summary: Determines how fast will happen the transition of each separate pixel. Default is 1. 0 will swap the old colors with the new without transition. High values will make the transition ignore the ProgressMap. Best used with values in range 0.1 to 1.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveRotationTransition.NewPlaneEasing
member.summary: The easing of the old plane's rotation animation.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveRotationTransition.OldPlaneEasing
member.summary: The easing of the old plane's rotation animation.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveRotationTransition.Direction
member.summary: The direction of the rotation

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveRotationTransition.RotationLength
member.summary: The degrees which the planes will rotate. Default is 180. Most meaningful are 180 and 90 but other angles may be used with proper Z-centers of rotation.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveRotationTransition.CameraDistance
member.summary: The distance from the camera to the image relative to the image size.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveRotationTransition.NewPlaneCenterOfRotationX
member.summary: The horizontal center of rotation of the new content plane relative to the image size. 0 is left 1 is right. Default is 0.5 - center.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveRotationTransition.NewPlaneCenterOfRotationY
member.summary: The vertical center of rotation of the new content plane relative to the image size. 0 is top 1 is bottom. Default is 0.5 - center.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveRotationTransition.NewPlaneCenterOfRotationZ
member.summary: The depth of the center of rotation of the new content plane relative to the image size. Default is 0.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveRotationTransition.OldPlaneCenterOfRotationX
member.summary: The horizontal center of rotation of the old content plane relative to the image size. 0 is left 1 is right. Default is 0.5 - center.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveRotationTransition.OldPlaneCenterOfRotationY
member.summary: The vertical center of rotation of the old content plane relative to the image size. 0 is top 1 is bottom. Default is 0.5 - center.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveRotationTransition.OldPlaneCenterOfRotationZ
member.summary: The depth of the center of rotation of the old content plane relative to the image size. Default is 0.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveRotationTransition.NewPlaneRenderBack
member.summary: Specify whether the new content plane should be rendered if the camera is looking at its back.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveRotationTransition.OldPlaneRenderBack
member.summary: Specify whether the old content plane should be rendered if the camera is looking at its back.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveTransitionPlaneState
member.summary: Provides a human readable state of a 3D plane. The properties are easy to understand and animate in the OnProgressChanged of a PerspectiveTransition.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveTransitionPlaneState.RotationX
member.summary: The rotation around the X axis in radians.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveTransitionPlaneState.RotationY
member.summary: The rotation around the Y axis in radians.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveTransitionPlaneState.RotationZ
member.summary: The rotation around the Z axis in radians.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveTransitionPlaneState.CenterOfRotationX
member.summary: The horizontal position of the center of rotation. The value is relative to the size of the image.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveTransitionPlaneState.CenterOfRotationY
member.summary: The vertical position of the center of rotation. The value is relative to the size of the image.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveTransitionPlaneState.CenterOfRotationZ
member.summary: The depth position of the center of rotation. The value is relative to the size of the image.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveTransitionPlaneState.LocalOffsetX
member.summary: The horizontal offset of the plane. The value is relative to the size of the image.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveTransitionPlaneState.LocalOffsetY
member.summary: The vertical offset of the plane. The value is relative to the size of the image.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveTransitionPlaneState.LocalOffsetZ
member.summary: The depth offset of the plane. The value is relative to the size of the image.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveTransitionState
member.summary: Provides information about the planes with the old and new content in a PerspectiveTransition.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveTransitionState.CameraDistance
member.summary: The distance from the camera to the display. Values less then 1 may render artifacts. Values near 2 render best perspective feeling. Large value will result in almost stereometrical projection.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveTransitionState.NewPlaneTransform
member.summary: Provides simplified coordinates and rotation of the plane with image of the new content.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveTransitionState.OldPlaneTransform
member.summary: Provides simplified coordinates and rotation of the plane with image of the old content.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveTransitionState.NewPlaneColorMultiply
member.summary: The color of the new image will be multiplied by this value. Default is white which does not affect the image. Transparent renders invisible. Any other color will filter the image.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveTransitionState.OldPlaneColorMultiply
member.summary: The color of the old image will be multiplied by this value. Default is white which does not affect the image. Transparent renders invisible. Any other color will filter the image.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveTransitionState.IsNewInFrontOfOld
member.summary: If true the new image is rendered in front of the old. If false the new image is behind the old.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveTransitionState.NewPlaneRenderBack
member.summary: If true the plane with the new image will be rendered even if the camera is looking at its back. If false it will not be rendered if looked from behind.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.TransitionEffects.PerspectiveTransitionState.OldPlaneRenderBack
member.summary: If true the plane with the old image will be rendered even if the camera is looking at its back. If false it will not be rendered if looked from behind.

FYI: A circular reference can be a formula that refers to its own cell value, or refers to a cell dependent on its own cell value..

member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to We found a problem with this formula. Try clicking Insert Function on the Formulas tab to fix it.
Not trying to type a formula? When the first character is an equal (=) or minus (-) sign, RadSpreadsheet thinks it is a formula. For example, when you type =1+1 the cell shows 2..

member.summary:

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_ErrorExpressions_InvalidSheetNameErrorMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Sheet name is not valid. A valid sheet name must meet the following criteria: - The name cannot be empty - The name cannot exceed 31 characters - The name cannot start or end with a single quote (') - The name cannot contain any of the following characters: \ / ? * [ ] :.

member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to Your formula is incomplete. You must include an operand following each operator. For example, =A1+A2+ is missing an operand following the second plus sign. Try one of the following:
Add the missing operand to the formula, or delete the extra operator. If you are not trying to enter a formula, avoid using an equal sign (=) or a minus sign (-)..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Acos_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns the arccosine, or inverse cosine, of a number. The arccosine is the angle whose cosine is number. The returned angle is given in radians in the range 0 (zero) to pi..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Acos_NumberInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is the cosine of the angle you want and must be from -1 to 1..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Acosh_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns the inverse hyperbolic cosine of a number. The number must be greater than or equal to 1. The inverse hyperbolic cosine is the value whose hyperbolic cosine is number, so ACOSH(COSH(number)) equals number..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Acosh_NumberInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is any real number equal to or greater than 1..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Acot_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns the principal value of the arccotangent, or inverse cotangent, of a number..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns the inverse hyperbolic cotangent of a number..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_AmorDegrc_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns the depreciation for each accounting period. This function is provided for the French accounting system. If an asset is purchased in the middle of the accounting period, the prorated depreciation is taken into account. The function is similar to AMORLINC, except that a depreciation coefficient is applied in the calculation depending on the life of the assets..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Asin_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns the arcsine, or inverse sine, of a number. The arcsine is the angle whose sine is number. The returned angle is given in radians in the range -pi/2 to pi/2..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Asin_NumberInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is the sine of the angle you want and must be from -1 to 1..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Asinh_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns the inverse hyperbolic sine of a number. The inverse hyperbolic sine is the value whose hyperbolic sine is number, so ASINH(SINH(number)) equals number..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Asinh_NumberInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is any real number equal to or greater than 1..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Atan_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns the arctangent, or inverse tangent, of a number. The arctangent is the angle whose tangent is number. The returned angle is given in radians in the range -pi/2 to pi/2..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Atan_NumberInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is the tangent of the angle you want..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Atan2_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns the arctangent, or inverse tangent, of the specified x- and y-coordinates. The arctangent is the angle from the x-axis to a line containing the origin (0, 0) and a point with coordinates (x_num, y_num). The angle is given in radians between -pi and pi, excluding -pi..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Atan2_XNumInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is the x-coordinate of the point..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Atan2_YNumInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is the y-coordinate of the point..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Atanh_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns the inverse hyperbolic tangent of a number. Number must be between -1 and 1 (excluding -1 and 1). The inverse hyperbolic tangent is the value whose hyperbolic tangent is number, so ATANH(TANH(number)) equals number..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Atanh_NumberInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is any real number between -1 and 1 excluding -1 and 1..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Average_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns the average (arithmetic mean) of its arguments, which can be numbers or names, arrays, or references that contain numbers..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Average_NumberInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to number1, number2,... are the numeric arguments for which you want the average..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_AverageA_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Calculates the average (arithmetic mean) of the values in the list of arguments. Logical values and text representations of numbers that you type directly into the list of arguments are counted..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_AverageA_NumberInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to number1, number2,... are 1 to 30 cells, ranges of cells, or values for which you want the average..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Bin2Dec_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Converts a binary number to decimal..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Bin2Dec_NumberInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The binary number you want to convert. Number cannot contain more than 10 characters (10 bits). The most significant bit of number is the sign bit. The remaining 9 bits are magnitude bits. Negative numbers are represented using two's-complement notation..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Bin2Hex_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Converts a binary number to hexadecimal..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Bin2Hex_NumberInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The binary number you want to convert. Number cannot contain more than 10 characters (10 bits). The most significant bit of number is the sign bit. The remaining 9 bits are magnitude bits. Negative numbers are represented using two's-complement notation..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Bin2Hex_PlacesInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The number of characters to use. If places is omitted, BIN2HEX uses the minimum number of characters necessary. Places is useful for padding the return value with leading 0s (zeros)..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Bin2Oct_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Converts a binary number to octal..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Bin2Oct_NumberInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The binary number you want to convert. Number cannot contain more than 10 characters (10 bits). The most significant bit of number is the sign bit. The remaining 9 bits are magnitude bits. Negative numbers are represented using two's-complement notation..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Bin2Oct_PlacesInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The number of characters to use. If places is omitted, BIN2OCT uses the minimum number of characters necessary. Places is useful for padding the return value with leading 0s (zeros)..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_BitAnd_Info

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_BitLShift_Info

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_BitXor_Info

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Ceiling_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns number rounded up, away from zero, to the nearest multiple of significance. For example, if you want to avoid using pennies in your prices and your product is priced at $4.42, use the formula =CEILING(4.42,0.05) to round prices up to the nearest nickel..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Ceiling_NumberInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is the value you want to round..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Ceiling_SignificanceInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is the multiple to which you want to round..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_CeilingMath_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Rounds a number up to the nearest integer or to the nearest multiple of significance..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_CeilingMath_ModeInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to For negative numbers, controls whether Number is rounded toward or away from zero..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_CeilingMath_NumberInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is the value you want to round. Number must be less than 9.99E+307 and greater than -2.229E-308..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_CeilingMath_SignificanceInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is the multiple to which you want to round..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_CeilingPrecise_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns a number that is rounded up to the nearest integer or to the nearest multiple of significance. Regardless of the sign of the number, the number is rounded up. However, if the number or the significance is zero, zero is returned..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_CeilingPrecise_NumberInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is the value you want to round.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_CeilingPrecise_SignificanceInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is the multiple to which you want to round. If significance is omitted, its default value is 1.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Char_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns the character specified by a number. Use CHAR to translate code page numbers you might get from files on other types of computers into characters..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Char_NumberInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is a number between 1 and 255 specifying which character you want. The character is from the character set used by your computer..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Choose_IndexInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Specifies which value argument is selected. Must be a number between 1 and 254, or a formula or reference to a cell containing a number between 1 and 254..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Choose_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Uses the number parameter to return a value from the list of value arguments..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Choose_ValueInfo

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_If_Info

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_If_LogicalTestInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Any value or expression that can be evaluated to TRUE or FALSE. member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_If_ValueIfFalseInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The value that you want to be returned if the logical test argument evaluates to FALSE. If logical test evaluates to FALSE and the value of [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_If_ValueIfTrueInfo

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Pv_FvInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is future value, or a cash balance you want to attain after the last payment is made. If fv is omitted, it is assumed to be 0 (the future value of a loan, for example, is 0). For example, if you want to save $50,000 to pay for a special project in 18 years, then $50,000 is the future value. You could then make a conservative guess at an interest rate and determine how much you must save each month. If fv is omitted, you must include the pmt argument..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Pv_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns the present value of an investment. The present value is the total amount that a series of future payments is worth now. For example, when you borrow money, the loan amount is the present value to the lender..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Pv_NperInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is the total number of payment periods in an annuity. For example, if you get a four-year car loan and make monthly payments, your loan has 4*12 (or 48) periods. You would enter 48 into the formula for nper..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Pv_PmtInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is the payment made each period and cannot change over the life of the annuity. Typically, pmt includes principal and interest but no other fees or taxes. For example, the monthly payments on a $10,000, four-year car loan at 12 percent are $263.33. You would enter -263.33 into the formula as the pmt. If pmt is omitted, you must include the fv argument..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Pv_RateInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is the interest rate per period. For example, if you obtain an automobile loan at a 10 percent annual interest rate and make monthly payments, your interest rate per month is 10%/12, or 0.83%. You would enter 10%/12, or 0.83%, or 0.0083, into the formula as the rate..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_SumIf_Criteria
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The criteria in the form of a number, expression, a cell reference, text, or a function that defines which cells will be added. For example, criteria can be expressed as 32, \">32\", B5, 32, \"32\", \"apples\", or TODAY()..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_SumIf_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to You use the SUMIF function to sum the values in a range that meet criteria that you specify. For example, suppose that in a column that contains numbers, you want to sum only the values that are larger than 5. You can use the following formula: =SUMIF(B2:B25,">5"). In this example, the criteria is applied the same values that are being summed. If you want, you can apply the criteria to one range and sum the corresponding values in a different range. For example, the formula =SUMIF(B2:B5, "John", C2:C5) sums [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_SumIf_Range
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The range of cells that you want evaluated by criteria. Cells in each range must be numbers or names, arrays, or references that contain numbers. Blank and text values are ignored..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_SumIf_SumRange
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The actual cells to add, if you want to add cells other than those specified in the range argument. If the sum_range argument is omitted, RadSpreadsheet adds the cells that are specified in the range argument (the same cells to which the criteria is applied)..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is a number specifying the precision of the truncation. The default value for num_digits is 0 (zero)..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Type_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns the type of value. Use TYPE when the behavior of another function depends on the type of value in a particular cell..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Type_ValueInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to can be any RadSpreadsheet value, such as a number, text, logical value, and so on..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Upper_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Converts text to uppercase..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Vdb_CostInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is the initial cost of the asset..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Vdb_EndPeriodInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is the ending period for which you want to calculate the depreciation. End_period must use the same units as life..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Vdb_FactorInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is the rate at which the balance declines. If factor is omitted, it is assumed to be 2 (the double-declining balance method). Change factor if you do not want to use the double-declining balance method. For a description of the double-declining balance method, see DDB..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Vdb_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Returns the depreciation for each accounting period. This function is provided for the French accounting system. If an asset is purchased in the middle of the accounting period, the prorated depreciation is taken into account. The function is similar to AMORLINC, except that a depreciation coefficient is applied in the calculation depending on the life of the assets..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Vdb_LifeInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is the number of periods over which the asset is depreciated (sometimes called the useful life of the asset)...

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Vdb_NoSwitchInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A logical value specifying whether to switch to straight-line depreciation when depreciation is greater than the declining balance calculation..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Vdb_SalvageInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is the value at the end of the depreciation (sometimes called the salvage value of the asset). This value can be 0..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Vdb_StartPeriodInfo
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to is the starting period for which you want to calculate the depreciation. Start_period must use the same units as life..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_VHLookup_TableArray
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A table of text, numbers or logical values, in which the data is looked up. Table_array can be a reference to a range or a range name..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_VLookup_ColIndexNum
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The column number in table_array from which the matching value should be returned. The first column of values in the table is column 1..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_VLookup_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The VLOOKUP function looks for a value in the leftmost column of a table or array of values and then returns a value in the same row from a column you specify. By default, the table must be sorted in an ascending order..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_VLookup_LookupValue
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The value to be found in the first column of the table. It can be a value, a reference or a text string..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_VLookup_RangeLookup
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A logical value: to find the closest match in the first column (sorted in ascending order) = TRUE or omitted; find an exact match = FALSE..

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Controls.Strings.Spreadsheet_Functions_Xor_Info
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The result of XOR is TRUE when the number of TRUE inputs is odd and FALSE when the number of TRUE inputs is even..
